question: What is "Finnish Maiden"?
option1: The first woman prime minister of Finland who successfully resisted the Russian invasion.
option3: The all-woman party of Finland which fought against Russian invasion.
option4: The first woman prime minister of Finland who successfully resisted the German invasion.
explanation: Finnish Maiden or the Maiden of Finland is the national personification of Finland. As a symbol, the Finnish Maiden has been used since the 19th century when she was pictured as a woman wearing a turreted crown and then developing as Finland gained a national consciousness and independence. She was depicted in poetry and fine arts. Zachris Topelius and Walter Runeberg were important in establishing Finnish Maiden as a symbol.
